content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Very well-constructed and creative clash of code! 

I have coded my solution under the time limit, which is a perfect problem for Clash of Code. 

The only thing that I would specify in your description is that the resistor colour code will be provided in the first 10 lines of the input as a note to make it clearer. 

Well done! 


My solution in Python: 

colour = [input() + " " for i in range(10)]
resis = [int(i) for i in list(input())]
print(colour[resis[0]] + colour[resis[1]] + colour[len(resis[2:])].strip())
simple yet effective

Sir... i have many questions...
1) your table have three columns: Colour Number Multiplier...what is the meaning of the column Number?

2) why you give the input the same list of colors all the time?

3) what does it mean this sentence: "The first two coloured rings represent the first two significant figures of the resistivity."?

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Cool problem. Suitable for fastest.
Also, is it possible to align the color table?

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Seems fun
I think the idea is interesting, but it is a hassle to hard-code all the color-digit correspondence. Maybe reduce the number of options?

❌ Rejected the contribution.
Comment: 
1) I don't know English
2) I use Google Translate
3) I read the task 3 times, but I still don't understand what I need to do.
4) I wouldn't want this task to come to me in "Clash of code", because I'll spend a lot of time trying to understand it, not solve it.
5) Maybe I'm stupid, but stupid people can vote here too. I vote against.
6) No offense. I am also doing the quest to reject one contribution and this contribution will be yours. Just kidding ;)
Please do upvote and approve this contribution if it is to your liking. I am doing this quest where I have to get 5 upvotes for a clash of code contribution to proceed to the next quest. Thank you
None Taken. Thank you for your honest comment. I will try to keep this in mind in the coming future .

Thank You. I agree it is a hassle but even for single digit resistance ie 0-9 it will be necessary to hard-code all colour code value. If I provide a dictionary containing all the values it just defeats the purpose of the clash to be the fastest. Reducing the no. of options will cause loopholes in the cases
It is possible if the author uses the monospace format.

The number column signifies the digit which corresponds to the respective colour.
I am giving the same list of colours all the time because @IGPro recommended that it would be difficult to hard code all the colour values.
The first two significant digits are the first two non zero integers. To represent them as colour code two colours are used. for eg.54 can be represented as Green(5) Yellow(4)
Thank You for your valuable feedback. I have already specified that the first 10 lines are the colour codes in the input section.
So you did. Sorry about that lol
No problem. :)

ooh.... now i get the problem much better..... might i recommend to replace this sentence:

"The first two coloured rings represent the first two significant figures of the resistivity" to "The first two coloured rings represent the first two significant digits of the resistivity"

i think that change might fit better because the resistivity is a number type and the resistor has the colours.

also... more test cases might be a very good idea.... some examples of some interesting test cases could be (i will only write the resistor value):

input
1
output
Black Brown Black

input
20
output
Black Red Brown

input
3000000
output
Black Orange Blue

input
99000000000
output
White White White

more test cases where you cover that all two first digits are in the r value.

and change the r constraint to
0 < r < 100,000,000.000
I have replaced the sentence . will update the test cases later.
Maybe the value of resistance could be specified in bases other than 10. Say, 4?

Yeah that could potentially work but the problem is that it will cause a lot less variation and also is not that realistic. maybe I will provide with the dictionary to avoid this hassle.Thanks for your idea
Yeah I have modified the clash to provide the colour codes as input.
Please amend the Input section description. Thanks.
Ohh forgot to do that. Done. Thanks for reminding.
You've reversed the order. It should be <<Lines 1 to 10>> for the colour codes, and then <<Next line>> or <<Line 11>> for the resistivity.
